Text.Text: Hah!  More would-be heroes up the river by the light of Bremen's fires, yes?  Well, whether you're saviors or sell-swords, have a drink with me...
Questions?  Bah!  There are drinks to be had first!  Come - Gohar the tavernkeeper charges but three coins for this wolf piss he calls "drink."  Have a flagon with me...
Oh... 'you'd rather not?'  What ails you, southerner... too good to drink with me?  Bah, get out of my sight!
Hah!  That's the spirit!  Enjoy the drink, then - it's not *quite* as foul as I make it to be... hah!  Now, what questions hound you?
Me?  I am Guthewulfe Henghelm, a river trader along the Shaengarne when the water runs free... and in the winter months, just one of the dogs that drinks the chill away in this pit of a tavern.

Town's been buying lumber in droves - I brought some down the river from Lonelywood myself.  It's for the new palisade - there's word that more goblinoids are gathering in the wild, and Targos' little lord is being careful... wise for a Townsman, I'd say.

The town's on edge because of the goblin sappers at the docks and because of Bremen - you saw what was left after the goblins struck it, no?  Heh... and I'd been planning to set out there next to pick up some textiles to sell in Lonelywood.  Looks like I'll be staying a bit longer in Targos now, eh?  Ha!

The town's still worried, and I don't blame them - it's said those goblinoids were just one paw on a bigger bear.  Myself, I'd been thinking of heading upriver... but I'll stay here a bit longer to see how things work out.  The Dale might not be safe for much longer.

This?  A wolf totem... a good luck charm.  I won it from my cousin's husband who thought he'd beat me at my best game!  Perhaps some dark day I'll run across a man with a stronger gut than me, then I'll pass the charm on to him...

Hah!  Here's the deal, then: you win - HAH! - and the wolf charm's yours.  You lose, no matter - but either way, you're paying for the braehg we swallow:  the stuff's not easy to come by, what with the wild boars and all.  It's five gold a round...
Well, now, maybe some other time when you've got some coin to spare.  Too bad... I'd been looking for some sport to shake off the winter's chill.

Oh, you will?  I may be a great bear of a northerner, but I'm not the fool you take me for -- I've seen your kind tip back kegs without so much as blinking.  I'm not going to wager my charm on racing a dwarf to the tavern floor.
Hah!  Not many lasses willing to take me up on my game... well, then, let's get to it!  Here's my wineskin - try not to throw it up right away...
Hah!  Let's get to it, then!  Here's my wineskin - try not to throw it up right away...
Heh-heh... you're not looking too good, friend.  No shame in caving in...
So, you can hold your braehg after all - you must have northern blood in your veins!  Hmmm... or this batch is becoming sour.
Heh.  I'm surprised you've lasted so long.  You... eh, you ready to give up yet?
Eh... heh-heh... rem... remember that's *boar's blood* you're drinking, there, friend... might not st... heh... stay in your stomach long... heh-heh...
Oooh... er.. I... I... hhhh-HRRRRKK!
Hah!  Back again, eh?
Of course you do!  But you know my rules... have a flagon with me, friend, or no answers from me.  It's only three gold, after all...
Eh?  What're you *doing* here?  There's an army of stinking goblins attacking the town!  Now's no time for chewing fat...
Well, all hail the infamous Irongut of Targos!  I hope you're enjoying my wolf charm, heh-heh...

Heh... I may not look the part, but a trader's heart I have.  I enjoy barter, almost as much as the sounds and smells of the rivers I ply.  Besides... townsmen merchants fear to cheat so fierce a man, you see?  Hah-hah!

We take turns at swigging *braehg* - boar's blood, mixed with milk.  It'll put girth on your arms and fire in your loins, but a mouthful's enough to make any Townsman spill his guts - hah!  Up for it?

Hah!  Goblins in Targos?  Nay, friend - we would have heard a warning horn from the Palisade, and the night's been silent, it has... well, at least there's been no goblins in *here.*  Take me for a simple tribesman, do you?
Are you *serious,* then?  Aye... I can see by your eyes it's true - damn it all, to think the cowardly bastards would attack now!
Hold!  Are you *serious,* then?  Aye... I can see by your eyes it's true - damn it all, to think the cowardly bastards would attack now!

Hah!  Ever since I refused to serve on the Palisade and freeze my stones off, the Targos Guard has forbidden me to use my axe within the city walls - not my choice... but I gave my word, and I cannot break it.

Ah, but that doesn't mean I couldn't sell iron to you, should you need it - I'm a trader, and it could be I have some arms stashed away for a moment such as this.   You look like you could use some good iron by your side.

Heh... I may not look the part, but a trader's heart I have.  I enjoy barter, almost as much as the sounds and smells of the rivers I ply.  Besides... townsmen merchants fear to cheat so fierce a man, you see?  Hah-hah!

This?  A wolf totem... a good luck charm.  I won it from my cousin's husband who thought he'd beat me at my best game!  Perhaps some dark day I'll run across a man with a stronger gut than me, then I'll pass the charm on to him...
But enough of that, there's goblins to be killed!  Mayhap when the goblins are driven back to their skulking holes, ye can try to win the wolf totem from me, eh?  Ha!
Hah!  Well, now, have you come to carve me up as you did Black Geoffrey over in the corner there?  A fine battle that was!  Well, whether you're saviors or sell-swords, have a drink with me...
Hah!  Well, now, have you come to carve me up as you did Black Geoffrey over in the corner there?  A fine battle that was!  Well, whether you're saviors or sell-swords, have a drink with me...
Did you know goblins are attacking the town?
There's a goblin attack taking place - grab your weapons, we need all the help we can get.
Actually, I had some questions I wanted to ask you instead.
Perhaps another time.  Farewell.
What goods do you have to trade?
Very well, I'll buy a drink...
I'd rather not.
I don't have enough gold.  Farewell.
Perhaps another time.  Farewell.
Wait... on second thought, I'll buy a drink.
I don't have enough gold.  Farewell.
Farewell, then.
Tell me about yourself.
What goods do you have to trade?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
That silver charm you have... what is it?
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
Never mind.  Farewell.
Judging from your size and weapons, you seem to be more a warrior than a trader.
A river trader?  What goods do you have to trade?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
That silver charm you have... what is it?
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
Thanks.  Farewell.
What else have you heard?
What goods do you have to trade?
Tell me about yourself.
That silver charm you have... what is it?
That silver charm you have... what is it?
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
Thanks.  Farewell.
I suppose so.  Have you heard anything else?
What goods do you have to trade?
Tell me about yourself.
That silver charm you have... what is it?
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
What goods do you have to trade?
Tell me about yourself.
That silver charm you have... what is it?
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Game?  What game?
What goods do you have to trade?
Tell me about yourself.
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
I'll play... here's five gold for the first round.
I'll play... here's five gold for the first round.
I'll play... here's five gold for the first round.
Hmmm... I don't have five gold.
Never mind.  What goods do you have to trade?
Tell me about yourself.
What's been going on in Targos of late?
What's been going on in Targos of late?
What's been going on in Targos of late?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
What goods do you have to trade?
Tell me about yourself.
What's been going on in Targos of late?
What's been going on in Targos of late?
What's been going on in Targos of late?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Very well.  What goods do you have to trade?
Fine.  Tell me about yourself, then.
Very well.  What's been going on in Targos of late?
Very well.  What's been going on in Targos of late?
Very well.  What's been going on in Targos of late?
You're a wise man, Guthewulfe.  Farewell.
Here's to your health, Guthewulfe... and my new wolf charm.
Here's to your health, Guthewulfe... and my new wolf charm.
Wait... I must go.  Farewell.
Here's to your health, Guthewulfe... and my new wolf charm.
Here's to your health, Guthewulfe... and my new wolf charm.
Wait... I must go.  Farewell.
Less... talk, more... drink...
Less talk, more drink...
I don't have enough gold for another round...
Wait... I must go.  Farewell.
Hardly... let's have... another mouthful...
Hardly.  Let's have another mouthful...
I don't have enough gold for another round...
Wait... I must go.  Farewell.
I've... almost... got you, Guthewulfe.  One... more round...
That wolf charm's as good as mine, Guthewulfe.  One more... round...
I don't have enough gold for another round...
Wait... I must go.  Farewell.
"Lass," indeed.  I'll take that wolf charm now, you lightweight...
Victory... and your wolf charm... is mine.  You might want to clean up that mess you've made, Guthewulfe.
There are still goblins about.  Can we see what weapons you have to trade?
What's that silver charm you're wearing?  It looks magical.
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
Yes, but I cannot stay.  Farewell.
What goods do you have to trade?
I'd like to try to win that wolf charm of yours...
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
I have some questions...
I have some questions...
Not for long.  Farewell.
Never mind.  What goods do you have to trade?
Very well, I'll buy a drink...
I'd rather not.
I don't have enough gold.  Farewell.
Perhaps later.  Farewell.
We'll talk later, then.  Farewell.
I am indeed.  What goods do you have to trade?
Thanks.  I have some questions...
I'll take my leave, now.  Farewell.
What goods do you have to trade?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
Can you tell me what's been going on in Targos of late?
That silver charm you have... what is it?
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
Thanks.  Farewell.
I am... let's play.
Not just now.  Tell me about yourself.
Perhaps later.  What goods do you have to trade?
Actually, what's been going on in Targos of late?
Actually, what's been going on in Targos of late?
Actually, what's been going on in Targos of late?
Perhaps later.  Farewell.
It's no jest - goblins are running along the Targos docks, and we must take action.
Never mind, then.  I have no time to waste words on you.
So you'll come to help us?
So you'll come to help us?
You're a trader?
Where did you get that wolf charm you're wearing?  It looks magical.
Could we see what you have?
Perhaps I shall return, then.  Farewell.
Could we see what you have?
Where did you get that wolf charm you're wearing?  It looks magical.
Perhaps I shall return, then.  Farewell.
Could we see what you have to trade, then?
Perhaps I shall return after the goblins are driven back, then.  Farewell.
Did you know goblins are attacking the town?
There's a goblin attack taking place - grab your weapons, we need all the help we can get.
Actually, I had some questions I wanted to ask you instead.
That silver charm you have... what is it?
That silver charm you have... what is it again?
Perhaps another time.  Farewell.
There are still goblins about.  Can we see what weapons you have to trade?
What's that silver charm you're wearing?  It looks magical.
